xJUp17A8.title: Variation of gypsum morphology along deep core SG-1, western Qaidam Basin (northeastern Tibetan Plateau) and its implication to depositional environments
xJUp17A8.abstract: Abstract   The Qaidam Basin is an arid, closed, intermontane basin located on the northern margins of the Tibetan Plateau in China. A 938.5 m-long core (SG-1), dated between ∼2.8 Ma–0.1 Ma, was obtained from the western Qaidam Basin. Gypsum is one of major evaporative minerals in the core. A total of 201 gypsum samples were selected and their crystal morphologies were carefully investigated. The crystal habits are lenticular, prismatic, tabular, twinned, stubby, and aggregate. Prismatic crystals occur in the upper 723 m, while lenticular crystals exist almost entirely in the upper 523 m. Tabular crystals are the most common morphology. The total abundance of gypsum crystal (including tabular, lenticular, and prismatic forms) tends to increase with decreasing depth. The relationship between crystal habits and depositional environments is complex, because same morphology can appear in different environments, and different morphologies can also occur in the same depositional environment. However, the occurrence of different morphologies can be attributed to the variable growth rates caused by the inhibition effect of additional cations (e.g. Mg 2+ , Na + , K +  and Sr 2+ ) on particular lattice parameters and the variation in precipitation experiments.  The lattice parameters of the unit cell of gypsum, measured by X-ray diffraction method, are:  a  = 5.854–12.57 A;  b  = 9.654–16.231 A; and  c  = 5.163–14.024 A; β = 113.54–119.88°; Volume = 601.55–712.65 A 3 . The substitution of K + , Na +  and Mg 2+  for Ca 2+  can reduce  c -axis, while Sr 2+  can reduce  a  and  b  axes.  a / c ,  b / c ,  a / b  tend to increase with K + , Na +  and Mg 2+  and decrease with Sr 2+ . The Mg 2+ , Na + , K +  and Sr 2+  contents in gypsum show significant variability, with K/Ca molar ratios varying from 1.03 × 10 −4  to 32.08 × 10 −4 , Mg/Ca molar ratios from 0.0023 to 0.1629, Na/Ca molar ratios from 0.031 to 0.575, and Sr/Ca molar ratios from 5.59 × 10 −4  to 19.67 × 10 −4 . Sr 2+ , Mg 2+ , Na + , and K +  concentrations in gypsum mainly depend on growth rate and brine concentration.

LPGS1AIv.title: Cenozoic organic carbon isotope and pollen records from the Xining Basin, NE Tibetan Plateau, and their palaeoenvironmental significance
LPGS1AIv.abstract: Marine oxygen isotope records show that the Cenozoic global climate has undergone remarkable fundamental changes. However, how terrestrial ecosystems respond to these changes remains unclear. The Xining Basin on the northeastern Tibetan Plateau holds continuous fine fluvial-lacustrine sediments from the early Eocene to the early Miocene (between ~52Ma and 17Ma). This paper first presents total organic carbon isotope (δ13CTOC) and pollen records from the Xiejia section in the Xining Basin, as indicators of the long-term terrestrial paleoecosystem and paleoclimate changes in the Asian interior of NW China. The δ13CTOC record shows a long term persistently decreasing trend (from ~-20‰ to -23.5‰) superimposed with obvious cycles of five distinctive phases of heavier and lighter δ13CTOC values, along with short pulses of especially low values occurring at ~32.5Ma, 23Ma, 21.5Ma, and 18Ma. These variations generally correlate with changes of gymnosperm content or the ratio of gymnosperm to angiosperm (G/A); i.e., heavier δ13CTOC values correspond with higher gymnosperm content or higher G/A, as well as with global temperatures (for both long term trends and shorter term fluctuations). We propose that global temperatures might provide the major factor controlling the evolution of the gymnosperm content (and the G/A ratio) that determines the δ13CTOC in the sediments. The East Asian monsoon may not have reached this region during the deposition of the sediments, or alternatively, its signals could not clearly be identified in these low resolution paleoecologic records. © 2013 .

d2w6mjJG.title: A Novel Synthetic Process of Pentabromobenzyl Chloride
d2w6mjJG.abstract: A novel one-step synthetic process of pentabromobenzyl chloride was reported,using benzyl chloride as raw material,bromine as solvent as well as bromination reactant,and anhydrous aluminum trichloride as catalyst.The bromination proceeded entirely,giving rise to a high quality of product,and the yield was as high as 99.0%.The structure of pentabromobenzyl chloride was determined by both FT-IR and 1H NMR.Themal gravimetric analysis revealed that the product possesses high thermal stability.

e7SrXTOr.title: mRNA expression of Eph-Ephrin A in swine endometrium during embryo implantation
e7SrXTOr.abstract: Erythropoietin-producing hepatocellular receptor and ligand A(Eph-Ephrin A) plays important roles in embryo implantation in various mammals.In order to investigate the involvement of Eph-Ephrin A in swine embryo implantation,nine Yorkshire sows were killed on pregnancy day 13(pre-implantation),18(mid-implantation) and 24(post-implantation)(three each on a pregnancy day).Using real-time RT-PCR technology,mRNA expressions of nine genes in Eph-Ephrin A were studied in swine endometrium.The expressions of Eph A1,Eph A7,Ephrin A1 and Ephrin A5 continued to increase significantly(P<0.05) from pregnancy day 13 to 24.Ephrin A3 mRNA expression increased significantly from pregnancy day 13 to 18,following an sharp decrease from pregnancy day 18 to 24(P<0.01).Ephrin A4 expression curve was opposite to Ephrin A3.The results suggested that mRNA expression of Eph-Ephrin A might play important roles in regulating embryo implantation in swines.

XFF8QGgN.title: Magnetostratigraphy of deep drilling core SG-1 in the western Qaidam Basin (NE Tibetan Plateau) and its tectonic implications
XFF8QGgN.abstract: The Qaidam Basin is the largest intermontane basin of the northeastern Tibetan Plateau and contains a continuous Cenozoic sequence of lacustrine sediments. A ~. 1000-m-deep drilling (SG-1) with an average core recovery of ~. 95% was carried out in the depocenter of the Chahansilatu playa (sub-depression) in the western Qaidam Basin, aimed to obtain a high-resolution record of the paleoenvironmental evolution and the erosion history. Stepwise alternating field and thermal demagnetization, together with rock magnetic results, revealed a stable remanent magnetization for most samples, carried by magnetite. The polarity sequence consisted of 16 normal and 15 reverse zones which can be correlated with chrons 1n to 2An of the global geomagnetic polarity time scale. Magnetostratigraphic results date the entire core SG-1 at ~. 2.77. Ma to ~. 0.1. Ma and yielded sediment accumulation rate (SAR) ranging from 26.1. cm/ka to 51.5. cm/ka. Maximum SARs occurred within the intervals of ~. 2.6-2.2. Ma and after ~. 0.8. Ma, indicating two episodes of erosion, which we relate to pulse tectonic uplift of the NE Tibetan Plateau with subsequent global cooling. © 2012 University of Washington.

Bh3GJH3y.title: Magnetostratigraphy of Late Tertiary sediments from the Chinese Loess Plateau and its paleoclimatic significance
Bh3GJH3y.abstract:
The Late Tertiary red clay/bed sediments underlying the Quaternary loess-paleosol in the Chinese Loess Plateau possesses high-resolution
 paleoclimatic changes related to the uplift of the Tibetan Plateau. Magnetostratigraphy and susceptibility measurements are
 discussed in this paper. The paleomagnetic results show that the red clay/bed began to accumulate at about 8.1 Ma, which represents
 the oldest Late Tertiary deposit continuously in the central Loess Plateau. The magnetic susceptibility curves show stepwise
 increases since the initiation of red clay, superimposed on several peaks. Moreover, the magnetic susceptibility increased
 abruptly since 3.8 Ma, which probably indicates the inception of the modern East Asia monsoon system. Between 3.8 and 2.6
 Ma, the stepwise increases of susceptibility may imply progressively intensified East Asia summer monsoon activity related
 with the stepwise uplift process of the Tibetan Plateau.

Mr9yfn3y.title: Light Stabilization of Flame-Retarded Polypropylene
Mr9yfn3y.abstract: The light stabilization of flame-retarded polypropylene(PP) is a difficult technology with great challenge.This paper described several technical approaches for light stabilization of flame-retarded PP,reviewed some new flame-retarded PP systems with relatively good light stability,and discussed the requirements to the next-generation flame retardants and light stabilizers.In addition,some new additives which may be used for flame-retarded and light-stabilized PP and their performances were also forwarded.

Tv6pMrZq.title: AC magnetic susceptibility studies of Chinese red clay sediments between 4.8 and 4.1 Ma: Paleoceanographic and paleoclimatic implications
Tv6pMrZq.abstract: Recent studies show that measuring AC magnetic susceptibility (with in-phase χ′ and quadrature χ″ components) versus temperature provides an effective way to map the grain-size distribution of pedogenic maghemite. Applying this method, we mapped the pedogenic maghemite grain-size distribution of samples of the red clay sediments deposited on the Chinese Loess Plateau (CLP) during the interval 4.8–4.1 Ma, during which the validity of magnetic susceptibility as an East Asian summer monsoon precipitation intensity proxy has been questioned. The results show that the pedogenic maghemite grain-size distribution is the same as in the overlying loess-paleosol sequence and in the other intervals of the red clay sequence, suggesting similar pedogenesis mechanisms and marked precipitation seasonality on the CLP between 4.8 and 4.1 Ma compared with the other intervals. We argue that the seasonal position shift of the polar westerlies produces the required precipitation seasonality and thus produces a uniform pedogenic grain-size distribution during this time interval. Reconstructing paleo-rainfall on the central CLP on the basis of surface calibration results suggests that the intensification of the East Asian summer monsoon might be a key trigger for the subsequent significant ocean and cryosphere adjustments during the Pliocene.

wrfryrp7.title: Methoxy n-fatty acids in surface soils from the Gongga and Kunlun Mountains: Ecological implications
wrfryrp7.abstract:
GC-MS characteristics of surface soil samples from the eastern and northern Tibetan Plateau provide tentative identification
 of 8(-14)-Methoxy hexadecanoic acid (iME-16:0) and 9(-17)-methoxy octadecanoic acid (iME-18:0). Sixty surface soil samples
 were collected from the eastern slope of Gongga Mountain, at elevations ranging from ∼1230 to 4500 m (eastern Tibetan Plateau),
 and from the northern slope of West Kunlun Mountains, ranging from ∼1300 to 5500 m (northern Tibetan Plateau). This study
 also analyzed the methoxy n-fatty acids (MFAs) of Gongga Mountain tree leaves from six common living species, at the elevation of 2900–4200 m. MFAs dominate
 these samples, with more centrally located methoxy groups eluting earlier than those with methoxy groups located closer to
 the end of the main carbon chain. MFAs occur prominently in most of the Gongga Mountain soil samples (and from six tree samples)
 from dominantly coniferous and deciduous broadleaved forests. Other than in two narrow vegetation zones between 4000–4350
 m and 2900–3300 m, no MFAs were found in 19 Kunlun Mountains soil samples from areas covered mainly with montane desert and
 alpine desert steppe vegetation. Based on the inventory of plants and soils from which MFAs have been isolated, we conclude
 that the MFAs most probably originate from specific woody plants. If we can exclude some particular grasses as sources, MFAs
 may be specific woody plants-derived biomarkers; thus they would serve as an important additional proxy for comprehensive
 and precise ecological reconstructions.

Kz1x3oQc.title: Altitudinal effect of soil <Emphasis Type="Italic">n</Emphasis>-alkane <Emphasis Type="Italic">δ</Emphasis>D values on the eastern Tibetan Plateau and their increasing isotopic fractionation with altitude
Kz1x3oQc.abstract: Stable isotope paleoaltimetry has provided unprecedented insights into the topographic histories of many of the world’s highest mountain ranges. However, on the Tibetan Plateau (TP), stable isotopes from paleosols generally yield much higher paleoaltitudes than those based on fossils. It is therefore essential when attempting to interpret accurately this region’s paleoaltitudes that the empirical calibrations of local stable isotopes and the relations between them are established. Additionally, it is vital that careful estimations be made when estimate how different isotopes sourced from different areas may have been influenced by different controls. We present here 29 hydrogen isotopic values for leaf wax-derived n-alkanes (i.e., δDwax values, and abundance-weighted average δD values of C29 and C31) in surface soils, as well as the δD values of soil water (δDsw) samples (totaling 22) from Mount Longmen (LM), on the eastern TP (altitude ~0.8–4.0 km above sea level (asl), a region climatically affected by the East Asian Monsoon (EAM). We compared our results with published data from Mount Gongga (GG). In addition, 47 river water samples, 55 spring water samples, and the daily and monthly summer precipitation records (from May to October, 2015) from two precipitation observation stations were collected along the GG transect for δD analysis. LM soil δDwax values showed regional differences and responded strongly to altitude, varying from‒160‰ to‒219‰, with an altitudinal lapse rate (ALR) of‒18‰ km‒1 (R 2=0.83; p<0.0001; n=29). These δDwax values appeared more enriched than those from the GG transect by ~40‰. We found that both the climate and moisture sources led to the differences observed in soil δDwax values between the LM and GG transects. We found that, as a general rule, ε wax/rw, ε wax/p and ε wax/sw values (i.e., the isotopic fractionation of δDwax corresponding to δDrw, δDp and δDsw) increased with increasing altitude along both the LM and GG transects (up to 34‰and 50‰, respectively). Basing its research on a comparative study of δDwax, δDp, δDrw(δDspringw) and δDsw, this paper discusses the effects of moisture recycling, glacier-fed meltwater, relative humidity (RH), evapotranspiration (ET), vegetation cover, latitude, topography and/or other factors on ε wax/p values. Clearly, if ε wax-p values at higher altitudes are calculated using smaller ε wax-p values from lower altitudes, the calculated paleowaterδDp values are going to be more depleted than the actual δD values, and any paleoaltitude would therefore be overestimated.
keywords: Hydrogen isotope values for leaf wax-derived n-alkanes

M9WhbAu5.title: Cenozoic deformation history determined by restoration of the balanced section across the Qaidam Basin
M9WhbAu5.abstract: The Qaidam Basin,located in the northern margin of the Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau,was a large Mesozoic-Cenozoic basin and deposited huge thick continuous Cenozoic strata,which recorded well the geological events of collision between the India and Eurasian plates since～55Ma.Based on latest new progress in high resolution dating of the magnetostratigraphy,a technique of balanced section across the whole basin was applied to a NE-SW seismic-geological profile in the central Qaidam Basin to reconstruct the crust shortening history from collision and to understand the nature of the basin.The results showed that the Qaidam Basin began to deform nearly synchronous to the early collision,manifesting as a weak compression;the deformation increased significantly in the Middle and Late Eocene,and then weakened slightly,and began to accelerate rapidly from the Late Miocene,especially since the Pleistocene,implying the maximal shortening of the basin and rapid uplift of the northern Tibetan Plateau during that time.

aL1OyQVC.title: Preparation and Applications of Intumescent-type Flame Retardant
aL1OyQVC.abstract: As one of the promising approach on course of halogen-free for Flame Retardants,Intumescent-type flame retardant is paid more and more attentions.In this paper,a novel Intumescent-type flame retardant is prepared from DMMP(Ⅰ),melaminecyanurate(Ⅱ) and pentaerythritol(Ⅲ).Experiment results indicatshow that whenⅠ∶Ⅱ∶Ⅲ=5.0∶2.5∶0.83(weight),15% addition quantity of the Intumescent-type flame retardant can make the OI of unsaturated resin to 28.5.

rpzdyllv.title: Synthesis and Characterization of Tris(p-acetyphenyl)methane
rpzdyllv.abstract: Tris(p-acetyphenyl)methane(TAcPM) was synthesized using triphenylmethane and acetyl chloride as raw materials and anhydrous aluminum trichloride as catalyst.The influences of feed ratio,solvent,reaction temperature and workup on the yield were discussed in detail.The structure of the product was characterized by FT-IR,1H NMR,and elemental analysis.

WqvVciAb.title: Synthesis of novel halogen-free flame retardant ethylenediamine bis (diphenylphosphate)
WqvVciAb.abstract: A novel halogen-free flame retardant ethylenediamine bis (diphenylphosphate) (ENDP) was synthesized, using diphenylchlorophosphate (DPCP) and ethylenediamine as the raw materials, 4-(N, N-dimethyl) aminopyridine as the catalyst and triethylamine as the acid-binding agent. The molecule of ENDP contains both acid source and gas source, which are the crucial components of the intumescent flame retardant (IFR). The synergistic effect of phosphor and nitrogen in ENDP imparts high efficiency to the flame retardant, and the existence of diphenylphosphate groups gives rise to the plastification. The effects of solvent, reaction temperature, reaction time, and catalyst dosage on the ENDP yield were investigated. The optimum reaction conditions are as follows: tetrahydrofuran (THF) as the solvent, at 45 °C for 8 h, the mass ratio of DMAP to DPCP is around 3%, and the yield of ENDP can reach up to 88.0%. The structure of ENDP was characterized by FT-IR, 1H NMR and MS. The thermal analysis of ENDP indicates that the product possesses high thermal stability. The onset decomposition temperature and maximum decomposition temperature are 265 °C and 365 °C, respectively, and the char residue at 450 °C still remains 20%.

cN9QuJ8c.title: Synthesis of Antiblaze V6 and Its Application in PU Foam
cN9QuJ8c.abstract: Antiblaze V6 was synthesized with pentaerythritol, phosphorus trichloride, dry chlorine gas, ethylene oxide raw materials and titanium tetrachloride as catalyst via three-step reaction, with a yield of 93.5%. The product and its intermediates were characterized by means of FT-IR, ~1H NMR, MS and elemental analysis. The product was applied to the flame retardance modification of PU foam. The result showed the flame retardant PU foam had good fire retardancy, and the optimum addition content of V6 was 20%.

TQYgOdPF.title: Process of monsoon variations of the northeastern Qinghai-Xizang Plateau from the loess record of Lonxi Basin since the last interglacial epoch
TQYgOdPF.abstract: Duanxian loess section of 40m thick is located at the seventh terrace of the Huanghe River,a pediment of Longxi Basin lying to the west of the Liupanshan Mountains in the northeastern Qinghai-Xizang Plateau.According to the 14C and TL age dating from six paleosol horizons and five loess layers which were found in the Duanxian section,it was estimated that the bottom of the section is at the boundary between MIS 5 and 6,and it can be compared with S1 in the Loess Plateau.Magnetic susceptibility,CaCO3 content and total organic carbon content are widely used as proxies of summer monsoon changes and grain size as proxy of winter monsoon.These proxies of a loess-paleosol sequence in Duanxian were measured.Their variations show that the northeastern part of the Qinghai-Xizang Plateau experienced 5 times of enhanced winter monsoon and 6 times of enhanced summer monsoon periods,respectively,since the last interglacial epoch.Although the variation of the Qinghai-Xizang Plateau monsoon can be compared with the oxygen isotopic stages in deep sea,outstanding difference exists between them.The strength of summer monsoon in interglacial epochs in northeastern Qinghai-Xizang Plateau is not always stronger than that in glacial epochs.The good correlation between variation of monsoon in the plateau and the Indian Ocean monsoon suggested linkage of them in similar forcing factors.Therefore,the results to conclude that changes of the Qinghai-Xizang Plateau monsoon may not be controlled by the change of global ice volume.On the contrary,orbital forcing might be responsible for climate changes in the northeastern Qinghai-Xizang Plateau since at least the last interglacial epoch.

t8ByNcea.title: Two quantitative methods of studying Orogenic belt uplift and denudation through basin-range sedimentary coupling
t8ByNcea.abstract: Intensive uplifting of mountains have great impact on climate and environment,so the uplift and denudation processes of orogenic belts have been a major focus problem in geosciences circles. Sedimentary basins adjacent to mountains have truely recorded plentiful information about the uplift and denudation processes of orogenic belts. Therefore, the history of uplift and denudation processes of orogenic belts can be reconstructed using basin-range sedimentary coupling theory. In this context, two quantitative methods were introduced to reconstruct the uplift and denudation processes of orogenic belts. The former is a thermochronology method to identify provenances of sediments in a basin and reconstruct the evolution of uplift, denudation and thermal history of the adjacent related orogenic belts through detrital zircon and apatite fission-track dating. The premise conditions are well-controlled stratigraphy ages and sediments without  suffering thermal modification since they deposited. The latter is a mass-balance method, supposing that erosion and denudation accumulation mass of provenance paleotopography in orogenic belts is in direct proportion to the detrital sediment mass of the related basin under a certain period in a closed basin-range sedimentary coupling system. Studies on total mass of sediments, and deposition rate of sedimentary basin are effective methods to quantitatively recover the paleotopography and furthermore to reconstruct the evolution of orogenic belts. However, the area boundaries of basin-range system and the precision of stratigraphy chronology have a great effect on this recovery and reconstruction.
t8ByNcea.venue: Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium, 2005. IGARSS '05. Proceedings. 2005 IEEE International

DopKxk6I.title: HIRM variations in the Chinese red-clay sequence: Insights into pedogenesis in the dust source area
DopKxk6I.abstract: Although extensive rock magnetic studies have been performed on the Chinese loess–paleosol sediments, few comparable studies have been applied to the underlying red-clay sediments. Because of this paucity of data, our understanding of the mineral magnetic properties of the red-clay sequence, and the paleoenvironmental information encoded in them, is limited. Here we report “hard” isothermal remanent magnetization (HIRM) variations from ∼8.1 to ∼1.2 Ma in the lower part of the loess–paleosol and the underlying red-clay sequences of the Chaona section on the Chinese Loess Plateau. The results indicate that there is a negative correlation between HIRM and frequency dependence of magnetic susceptibility χ fd ( χ fd = χ lf − χ hf , where χ lf and χ hf are magnetic susceptibility measured at 470 Hz and 4700 Hz, respectively) from ∼3.4 to ∼2.6 Ma and a positive correlation between these two proxies from ∼8.1 to ∼3.4 Ma and ∼2.6 to ∼1.2 Ma. We argue that the HIRM variations from ∼8.1 to ∼3.4 Ma and from ∼2.6 to ∼1.2 Ma reflect hematite availability in the dust source region, determined by the size of the area and climatic conditions of the dust source region. The negative correlation between HIRM and χ fd between ∼3.4 and ∼2.6 Ma suggests that magnetic enhancement during this time interval may be related to the alteration of hematite/goethite to magnetite/maghemite. We also find that HIRM data between 8.1 and 3.4 Ma show high coherence with the 100-kyr eccentricity signals, suggesting eccentricity forcing of concentration variations of hematite in the dust source area. Higher resolution samples are needed to determine if concentration variations of hematite in the dust source area are coherent with the orbital obliquity and precession forcing signals. Keywords Pliocene Monsoon Red-clay Loess Rock magnetism Hematite 1 Introduction A more complete picture of Cenozoic climate change and its driving mechanisms can only be obtained by an integrated analysis of widely distributed paleoclimate records. Recently a clearer picture of Cenozoic climatic history has appeared thanks to the work of Ocean Drilling Project (ODP) scientists ( Zachos et al., 2001 ). We now know that our climate system experienced a cooling trend starting from 55 million years ago (hereafter Ma) as well as many dramatic cooling events ( Zachos et al., 2001 ), i.e. the Oligocene-1 Glaciation around 34 Ma, the Miocene-1 Glaciation around 24 Ma, the intensification of the east Antarctic ice sheet around 14 Ma, and the onset of the Northern Hemisphere Glaciation around 3 Ma, before it reached a condition with major Northern Hemisphere glaciations occurring every 100–40 kyr. However, the driving mechanisms of both the overall cooling trend and these cooling events are poorly understood. This fact, therefore, calls for more effort from paleoclimatists working on long and continuous continental sediment record. In particular the uplift of the Tibetan Plateau (TP) is one of the strong candidates for the Cenozoic cooling trend and the onset of the glaciation by increasing chemical weathering and changing the atmospheric circulation patterns ( Raymo and Ruddiman, 1992; Rea et al., 1998 ). The aeolion dust sediment (i.e. loess) sequence on the Chinese Loess Plateau (CLP) is one of the best continental archives of paleoclimate change for the Late Cenozoic era ( Heller and Liu, 1982; Liu, 1985 ). The sediment sequence on the CLP consists of two units: the loess/paleosol unit and the underlying red-clay unit. The loess/paleosol unit is deposited during the last 2.6 Ma, whereas the red-clay unit is deposited between ∼8 and 2.6 Ma. Previous rock magnetic studies have generally focused on the loess/paleosol unit and only a few papers have explored the magnetic characteristics of the Chinese red-clay sediments on the CLP ( Hao et al., 2008a; Liu et al., 2003 ). Recent studies have begun to explore the magnetic enhancement mechanisms of the red-clay unit and find that there is no major difference between the red-clay unit and the overlying loess/paleosol unit ( Nie et al., 2007, 2008d ). This finding has improved our understanding of the sea–land–cryosphere coupling relationship prior to the onset of the intensive Northern Hemisphere glaciation ( Nie et al., 2008a,b,c,d,e ). However, few studies ( Hao et al., 2008a,b ) explore the concentration variations of hematite, the mineral responsible for the red color of soils, in the red-clay unit. Such knowledge is necessary to gain a better understanding of the magnetic mineral transformation processes during pedogenesis on the CLP and its dust source area. It has been suggested that the comparison between the concentration of hematite and that of magnetite/maghemite will provide insights into the origin of the hematite grains and the magnetic enhancement pathway ( Liu et al., 2008; Torrent et al., 2006 ). Here we report an environmental magnetic study of the lower part of the loess–paleosol and the underlying red-clay sediments from the Chaona section. In this study, we focus on variations in several magnetic parameters: (1) the saturation isothermal remanent magnetization imparted at 1.2 Tesla (T) (SIRM); (2) the back-field isothermal remanent magnetization imparted at −0.3 T (BIRM), which is the part of the SIRM that reverses direction after application a field of −0.3 T; and (3) the “hard” isothermal remanent magnetization (HIRM, defined as (SIRM+BIRM)/2, a concentration proxy ( King and Channell, 1991; Sangode and Bloemendal, 2004; Thompson and Oldfield, 1986 ) for high-coercivity minerals, especially hematite, to examine the temporal variation of hematite concentration with respect to other magnetic minerals. We compare these parameters to χ fd , a proxy for the concentration of ultrafine magnetic materials (primarily maghemite) produced during pedogenesis ( Liu et al., 2004; Nie et al., 2007 ), to determine the possible origin of the hematite grains. 2 Area descriptions and methods Powder samples were collected from the Chaona section (35°6′N, 107°12′E) using a sampling interval of 10–20 cm ( Fig. 1 ). The Chaona section lies at the Zhengjiashizi village, 5 km south of Chaona town in Lingtai County, at the foot of the eastern Liupan Mountains. The entire section is about 300 m in thickness with the upper 175 m comprising the loess–paleosol sequence and the underlying 125 m comprising the red-clay sequence. The loess–paleosol sequence consists of 32 paleosol and 33 loess units. An age model for the Chaona section has been established ( Lü et al., 2001 ) and it is based on an astronomical tuning of paleosols S1 through S32 for the loess–paleosol section ( Heslop et al., 2000 ) and paleomagnetic reversal ages ( Cande and Kent, 1995 ) for the red-clay sequence. The present study is mainly concerned with the mineral magnetic properties of the lower part of the loess–paleosol sequence and the red-clay sequence. For this study, ∼1000 samples (8–10 g) were taken every 20 cm from 90–300 m depth in the section. Remanence measurements (SIRM and BIRM) were made on the same samples previously measured for χ lf , χ hf , and χ ARM . The SIRM and BIRM were imparted in a constant field of 1.2 T and −0.3 T, respectively, and measured using a 2G Enterprises Model 755-R small-access cryogenic magnetometer. Following these measurement, HIRM values were calculated. All measurements were conducted in the Paleomagnetism Laboratory at the Graduate School of Oceanography of the University of Rhode Island. It has been shown that the HIRM method can produce higher random and systematic errors when the difference between SIRM and BIRM is small ( Liu et al., 2002 ). This error occurs because the HIRM method mathematically cancels out the anti-ferromagnetic background by subtracting the remanences imparted by two antiparrallel saturating fields. However, the background effects for each individual measurement (i.e. errors due to misalignment and viscosity) still exist and contribute to the measurement ( Liu et al., 2002 ). Therefore, any negative HIRM values (less than 0.5% of the total samples) in our data, which indicate that higher systematic errors exist and thus the differences between SIRM and BIRM are small, are set to zero to avoid confusion. Auto-spectra were generated using the REDFIT software package ( Schulz and Mudelsee, 2002 ) and cross-spectra were generated using the SPECTRUM software package ( Schulz and Stattegger, 1997 ). These two software packages are based on Lomb–Scargle Fourier transform in combination with the Welch-Overlapped-Segment-Averaging procedure, which do not require evenly-spaced temporal sampling and thus avoid enhancement of the low frequency components at the expense of high-frequency components ( Schulz and Mudelsee, 2002 ). Mössbauer spectra were measured at 4.2 K and room temperature. The measurements were performed with a conventional constant-acceleration spectrometer in transmission geometry with a source of 57 Co in an Rh matrix. Hyperfine parameters such as magnetic hyperfine field ( B HF ), isomer shift ( IS ) and quadrupole splitting ( QS ) have been determined by the NORMOS program ( Brand, 1987 ), and α-Fe at room temperature was used to calibrate isomer shifts and velocity scale. 3 Results The SIRM and BIRM data show similar fluctuation patterns to that of the χ fd with the highest values occurring around 2.75 Ma, whereas the HIRM data differs markedly ( Fig. 2 ). The HIRM shows little variability in the red-clay sequence with one exception from ∼2.79 to ∼2.71 Ma ( Fig. 2 ). During that time interval the values approach or are equal to zero. In contrast, corresponding χ fd values during this interval are the highest observed for the entire study interval (1.2–8.1 Ma) ( Fig. 2 ). The variability of the HIRM data increases dramatically in the loess–paleosol sequence, however, this increase is primarily caused by a dramatic increase in HIRM values in the paleosol layers, which correspond to higher χ fd values. The HIRM values observed in loess layers stay approximately the same as in the majority of the red-clay sequence ( Fig. 2 ). Figs. 3–5 are blown-up versions of Fig. 2 from ∼3.4 to ∼2.6 Ma, from ∼ 8.1 to ∼ 3.4 Ma, and from ∼2.6 to ∼1.2 Ma, respectively. A negative relationship between HIRM and the other magnetic parameters is observed from ∼3.4 to ∼2.6 Ma ( Fig. 3 ). The negative correlation between HIRM and χ fd from ∼3.4 to ∼2.6 Ma is more obvious in Fig. 6 . Figs. 4 and 5 show a positive correlation between HIRM and the other three parameters from ∼ 8.1 to ∼ 3.4 Ma and from ∼2.6 to ∼1.2 Ma. However, the variations of HIRM are significantly dampened in the interval from ∼8.1 to 3.4 Ma compared to the overlying loess–paleosol sequence (∼2.6–1.2 Ma) ( Fig. 2 ). These positive correlations are more obvious in Fig. 6 . The spectra characteristics between HIRM and June 21 insolation at 35°N ( Laskar, 1990 ) are compared in Fig. 7 . The autospectrum estimate of the HIRM time series between 8.1 and 3.4 Ma shows that the 20-kyr, 40-kyr, 100-kyr, 400-kyr, and 1-Myr signals are significant above the 80% significance level ( Fig. 7 a). The 20-kyr signal is significant above the 90% significance level, while the other orbital signals are just below the 90% significance level. In addition, a ∼70-kyr signal, which has no corresponding orbital periodicity ( Fig. 7 b) but has often been reported in loess studies, is observed and is significant at the 90% significance level ( Lu et al., 2004 ). The 1-Myr signal is significant at the 90% level but does not have a corresponding periodicity in the insolation spectra ( Fig. 7 b), which merits further studies. The 20-kyr and 40-kyr HIRM signals are coherent with insolation at the 80% significance level, and the 100-kyr signals are coherent with eccentricity at the 95% significance level, suggesting that, on these timescales, HIRM is forced by insolation ( Fig. 7 c). The large sample interval (20 cm, corresponding to a time interval of ∼9 kyr) is likely the reason for the observed weaker 20-kyr and 40-kyr band signals in the HIRM records and the lower coherence between HIRM and insolation at the 20-kyr and 40-kyr bands. Mössbauer spectra ( Table 1 ) measured at room temperature for the red-clay samples from the Chaona section only detect the presence of a sextet corresponding to hematite with magnetic order and doublets of Fe 3+ and Fe 2+ , a paramagnetic-like behavior. At 4.2 K, the doublets of Fe 3+ and Fe 2+ (representing iron silicates) and a sextet (related to goethite) were fitted, corresponding to ∼18 wt.% (of the total iron) for one red-clay sample (sample CN4940 corresponding to 4.73 Ma). This result indicates that goethite grains in the red-clay samples are within the superparamagnetic size and thus do not contribute to HIRM measured at room temperature ( Dyar et al., 2006 ). 4 Discussion 4.1 HIRM variations from 8.1 to 3.4 Ma and from 2.6 to 1.2 Ma and their paleoclimatic implications HIRM is generally used as a proxy for the concentration of the high coercivity magnetic minerals hematite and goethite but is a more sensitive indicator of hematite ( King and Channell, 1991; Sangode and Bloemendal, 2004; Thompson and Oldfield, 1986 ). The lower sensitivity for goethite is because goethite does not saturate until the imparted magnetic field is larger than 4 T, or even 7 T and thus (IRM 4 T + IRM −3 T )/2 has been used as a proxy for the concentration of goethite ( Sangode and Bloemendal, 2004 ), where IRM 4 T and IRM −3 T represent isothermal remanent magnetization imparted at 4 T and −3 T, respectively. A high correlation ( R 2 = 0.73) between the HIRM trend and the concentration of hematite from the L5 to L6 section at the Luochuan section on the Chinese Loess Plateau further confirmed the validity of HIRM as a proxy for the concentration of hematite especially at orbital timescales ( Liu et al., 2006 ). In addition, preliminary Mössbauer spectroscopy results did not detect goethite in the red-clay samples from the Chaona section ( Table 1 ) and paleosol samples from the Xi’an section ( Eyre and Dickson, 1995 ) at room temperature, but detected ∼18 wt.% (of the total iron) goethite for the Chaona red-clay samples at 4.2 K. This result indicates that goethite grains are mostly superparamagnetic and do not contribute to HIRM variations. A positive correlation between the concentration of pedogenic ferromagnetic minerals and hematite concentration in the Chinese loess–paleosol sequence has been reported ( Balsam et al., 2004 ). Our study confirms Balsam et al.’s finding. In addition, our results indicate that in the red-clay sequence, a positive correlation between the concentration of pedogenic ferrimagnets and hematite also exists. However, this positive correlation between the concentration of pedogenic ferrimagnetic minerals and hematite concentration can not be easily understood. It has been well established that a drier climate is a prerequisite for the production of hematite, but if so it seems anomalous for higher concentrations of hematite to occur in wetter interglacial periods corresponding to higher χ fd values. Torrent et al. (2006) have argued that this positive correlation between the concentration of pedogenic ferromagnetic minerals and hematite concentrations indicates that magnetic enhancement follows a different formation pathway, i.e. the ferrihydrite → maghemite → hematite route. However, the direct transition of ferrihydrite to maghemite has never been observed in natural soils ( Cornell and Schwertmann, 2003 ). We argue that the higher concentration of hematite must have come from the dust source region of the CLP, presumably the nearby Gobi deserts, rather than in situ production via pedogenic processes. Even in interglacial periods like today, the Gobi desert region is still an extremely arid area because the East Asian summer monsoon does not influence the area and moisture from the Indian summer monsoon is blocked by the Tibetan Plateau. Higher temperatures and drier climate will promote hematite formation, probably due to the dehydration of ferrihydrates ( Cornell and Schwertmann, 2003 ). The hematite in the Gobi deserts can be easily transported to the CLP via dust storms during winter and spring, thus causing a higher concentration of hematite in soils developed during interglacial periods. In comparison, the colder and drier climate during glacial periods will prevent production of hematite via dehydration of ferrihydrates in the Gobi desert region. Therefore, in glacial periods, we observed less hematite from loess layers on the CLP. This explanation is consistent with two independent lines of evidence: (1) The Luochuan section, which is closer to the source region, has a higher hematite content compared with the Lingtai section, which is farther from the source region ( Balsam et al., 2004 ) ( Fig. 1 ); (2) HIRM is a measure of the concentration of hematite grains with stable remanent magnetization, including larger single-domain, pseudo-single-domain, and multi-domain. In situ pedogeneis on the CLP tends to produce superparamegnetic and smaller single-domain magnetic grains ( Liu et al., 2007a; Nie et al., 2007; Zhou et al., 1990 ), whereas aeolion inputs to the CLP from the source regions include larger grain sizes ( Liu et al., 2007a ). Future studies, like those conducting magnetic measurements on a particle-size specific basis ( Hao et al., 2008b ), will be able to test our hypothesis. Compared with the loess–paleosol sequence, the concentration variations of hematite in the red-clay sequence are significantly dampened ( Fig. 2 ). However, the decreased variability in hematite concentration in the red-clay sequence is readily understandable. The North Pacific dust flux record shows that the dust source area in central Asia is much smaller during the time interval 8.1–∼3.6 Ma compared to ∼2.6–0 Ma ( Rea et al., 1998 ). The bigger dust source area in the last 2.6 Ma can be explained by climate cooling in the Asian interior during the Plio-Pleistocene, which is most likely controlled by intensification of Northern Hemisphere glaciation ( Raymo, 1994 ) and progressive uplift of the Tibetan Plateau beginning ∼3.6 Ma ( An et al., 2001; Fang et al., 1997; Fang et al., 2005, 2007; Li et al., 1997; Tapponnier et al., 2001 ). Hematite content variations are dampened from 8.1 to 3.4 Ma because the availability of hematite grains is significantly lower in the source region from 8.1 to 3.4 Ma. The y -axis intercepts in Figs. 6 a and b indicate averaged hematite contents in the dust source regions during glacial periods with less hematite production via dehydration of ferrihydrates. The higher intercept value (0.487 * 10 −3 Am 2 kg −1 ) in the lower part of the red-clay sequence indicates that the dust source region is more enriched in hematite during the interval of red-clay formation than during the interval of loess–paleosol formation. This observation is consistent with higher global temperature from 8.1 to 3.4 Ma as inferred from benthic oxygen isotope data ( Zachos et al., 2001 ). It is worth noting that several studies have suggested that poor soil drainage (or waterlogging) ( Ding et al., 2001; Guo et al., 2001 ) has affected their red-clay sections and thus it is possible that gleying may have affected the magnetic properties of part of the red-clay section. However, other studies ( An et al., 2001 ) found a good correlation between magnetic susceptibility and Rb/Sr, a chemical weathering proxy not sensitive to gleying, from their red-clay section, suggesting that gleying did not affect the magnetic properties of their red-clay section. Therefore, it seems that the occurrence of gleying in the red-clay sections on the CLP is site-dependent. The red-clay section that we study here was obviously not affected by waterlogging because: (1) we did not find apparent sedimentologic evidence of gleying from our studied section and (2) detailed rock magnetic studies from the same section show consistent grain size of pedogenically-produced ferromagnetic grains throughout the section ( Nie et al., 2007, 2008d ). If gleying had occurred periodically, fine-grained ferrimagnetic minerals would have preferentially been destroyed due to the reducing conditions associated with soil gleying ( Liu et al., 2001 ). 4.2 HIRM variations from 3.4 to 2.6 Ma and their paleoclimatic implications Workers have speculated ( Bloemendal and Liu, 2005; Liu et al., 2005; Maher, 1998 ) that, in the presence of iron-reducing bacteria and organic matter, “hard” or weakly magnetic minerals can be changed to “soft” strongly magnetic ferrimagnetic minerals via inorganic iron redox processes and thus magnetic enhancement would occur. However, corresponding supporting evidence is lacking ( Torrent et al., 2006 ). The negative correlation between HIRM and χ fd ( Figs. 3 and 6c ) strongly suggests that magnetic enhancement during this time interval is related to the alteration of hematite and thus supports the previously noted magnetic enhancement route. This negative correlation does not contradict our explanation that hematite grains on the CLP primarily come from the dust source region. During the time interval ∼3.4–∼2.6 Ma, we speculate that many bigger hematite grains coming from the dust source region have been partially or completely altered to either magnetite/maghemite, or smaller (probably superparamagnetic) hematite without a remanent magnetization. This time interval would be characterized by intermittently reducing soil conditions. These conditions would result from periods of intensified precipitation, likely coming from an intensified summer monsoon caused by the uplift of the Tibetan Plateau ( An et al., 2001; Fang et al., 1997, 2005, 2007; Li et al., 1997; Nie et al., 2008a,c,d; Tapponnier et al., 2001 ). 4.3 HIRM higher frequency variations before 3.4 Ma The 20-kyr, and 40-kyr HIRM signals are coherent with insolation at the 80% significance level, and the 100-kyr signals are coherent with eccentricity at the 95% significance level, suggesting that, on these timescales, HIRM is forced by insolation. The large sample interval (20 cm, corresponding to a time interval of ∼9 kyr) is likely the major reason for the observed weaker 20-kyr and 40-kyr band signals in the HIRM records and the lower coherence between HIRM and insolation at the 20-kyr and 40-kyr bands. 5 Conclusions 1. HIRM and χ fd in the study section have a positive correlation during the intervals ∼8.1–∼3.4 Ma and ∼2.6–∼1.2 Ma. We argue that the hematite concentration variations during these intervals reflect hematite availability in the dust source region, determined by the area and climatic conditions of the dust source region. 2. HIRM and χ fd in the Chaona section have a negative correlation during the intervals ∼3.4–∼2.6 Ma. The negative correlation suggests that magnetic enhancement during this time interval may be related to the alteration of hematite/goethite to magnetite/maghemite. This alteration would support the hypothesis that in the existence of iron-reducing bacteria and organic matter, “hard” or weakly magnetic minerals can be changed to “soft” ferrimagnetic minerals via inorganic iron redox processes and thus cause magnetic enhancement. We speculate that many larger hematite grains coming from the dust source region have been altered either completely or partially and changed into magnetite/maghemite or smaller (probably superparamagnetic) hematite without a remanent magnetization. This time interval would be characterized by relatively intermittent reducing soil conditions, probably caused by a period of intensified East Asian summer monsoon precipitation associated with the Pliocene northeastern uplift of the Tibetan Plateau. 6 Future work We propose that future work should test our hypothesis from two aspects: (1) Future studies should conduct magnetic measurements on a particle-size specific basis ( Hao et al., 2008b ) to figure out the exact grain size of the minerals represented by the HIRM record. (2) A recent study ( Liu et al., 2007b ) found that synthetic Al-substituted hematite and goethite exhibit a wide range of coercivities, which might influence the validity of HIRM as a proxy for concentration of hematite. These authors also found that HIRM reflects changes in the absolute concentration of hematite and/or goethite only if the L-ratio (defined as the ratio of two remanences after alternating field (AF) demagnetization of an IRM imparted in a 1 T field with a peak AF of 100 mT and 300 mT) is relatively constant. Another study ( Maher et al., 2004 ) suggests that AF demagnetization of HIRM with a peak AF field of 100 mT will effectively remove contribution of ferromagnetic grains to HIRM. Future studies should test our conclusions following these techniques. Acknowledgements We thank L. Lü for providing age-depth model of the Chaona section. We thank S. Yang, K. Fu, F. Wu, X. Chen, M. Dong, L. Lü for help in field work. This paper benefited significantly from formal reviews by J. Bloemendal and an anonymous reviewer and informal comments by Q. Liu, S. Banerjee, and T. Berquó. We also thank T. Berquó for generating Mössbauer data. xxtPZqPg.title: Synthesis of Four PEPA Derivatives as Flame Retardant
xxtPZqPg.abstract: Bis(2,6,7-trioxa-1-phosphabicyclooctane-4-methanol)chlorophosphate(intermediate I) and tris(2,6,7-trioxa-1-phosphabicyclooctane-4-methanol)phosphate(d) were synthesized from 1-oxo-4-hydroxymethy1-2,6,7-trioxa-1-phosphabicyclooctane(PEPA) and phosphorus oxychloride in molar ratios 2∶1 and 3∶1 respectively with the yields of 84.7% and 80%.The reaction of intermediate I with tribromophenol,pentabromobenzyl bromide and melamine respectively gave three other caged phosphates(a~c) in the yields of 70%,73.5% and 81%.All the title compounds were confirmed by FTIR,1HNMR and elementary analysis.Reaction conditions were also discussed.The result of thermal analysis showed that they all have high thermal stability and excellent char-forming ability,decomposition temperatures of compound a~d were 285,325,320 and 337 ℃,respectively,and residual carbon(w%) under 500 ℃ were 38.4%,26.3%,56.5% and 50.0%,respectively.

Finally, some sugesstions on carrying out emission reduction in flame retardants in China were presented.

zv0mddGr.title: Saline rhythm and climatic change since 20.6 kyr bp from the Qiulinanmu Playa Lake in Tibet
zv0mddGr.abstract: A rare lacustrine rhythmite from the Qiulinanmu Playa Lake in Tibet is presented, which was composed of distinct layers of mirabilite, borax, and clay with thickness measuring 1.5-75 cm, 0.5-20 mm, and 0.5-30 mm, respectively. The thickness of each layer was measured in the field and dating was performed using 14C and U data. The lake was previously supplied by river water, groundwater, and hot springs enriched in sodium, sulfur, and boron. Control factors on the rhythmite were climate oscillations and compositional differences of water. The adsorption of boron by clay minerals could be attributed to the alternation between clay and borax layers. Low temperature, high pH, and high evaporation exerted significant influences on the precipitation of original borax and mirabilite. In the evaporative lake, the precipitation of mirabilite (a mineral indicative of a cold-dry environment) was dominant and produced the asymmetric couplets. The lake water was poor in chloride and rich in sodium sulfate, and an abrupt change was observed at 11.4 cal. kyr bp. According to the laminated sediment and the thickness of the minerals, the climate was dry-cold with four sub-warm phases before 11.4 kyr bp (after 20.6-11.4 kyr bp), and wet-warm with four sub-cold pulses after 11.4 kyr bp (11.4-5.2 kyr bp). The two thickest mirabilite layers suggested extremely hard conditions after 20.6 kyr bp, and before 11.4 kyr bp, respectively. © 2010 Springer-Verlag.

59PiXkwE.title: Refuting the evidence for an earlier birth of the Taklimakan Desert
59PiXkwE.abstract: In a recent issue of PNAS, Zheng et al. (1) report a “Late Oligocene–Early Miocene age” of the Taklimakan Desert in northwest China. Their age was based on 40Ar/39Ar dating of biotites and U–Pb dating of zircons from layers within the Xiyu Formation, which they interpreted as “volcanic ash.” This chronology effectively extends the formation of the Taklimakan Desert from ∼5 Ma, as recently reported from outcrop (2) and high-resolution borehole data (3), to 27 Ma (1). After publication of this article, a field investigation was organized with its two leading authors (Hongbo Zheng and Xiaochun Wei) and 26 other geologists to more closely scrutinize the stratigraphy of the Xiyu Formation. Our new field and laboratory investigations do not support the existence …

58WF0tut.title: Rock-magnetic Characteristics of the Late Cretaceous-Early Miocene Sediments on the Kuzigongsu Section of the Northwestern Tarim Basin
58WF0tut.abstract: We have carried out an rock magnetism investigation and thermal demagnetization for the Late Cretaceous to Early Miocene sediments on Kuzigongsu section from the Northwestern Tarim basin,Western China.The results indicate that thermal demagnetization and rock magnetic characteristics of rocks can be divided into three types specifically.Rocks from sublittoral zone,shallow of platform edge are dominated by the pseudo-single domain(PSD) magnetite with a little amount of goethite and maghematite.Its natural remanence intensity is smaller than 1×10-2A/m generally,and the characteristic remanent magnetism(ChRM) are carried by magnetite and can be isolated from 250℃~500℃.Rocks from intertidal zone and supratidal zone are dominated by pseudo-single domain and multi-domain(PSD﹢MD) magnetite generally,with a little amount of goethite,maghematite and hematite.It's natural remanence intensity is between 1×10-2~1A/m,and the characteristic remanent magnetism(ChRM) are carried by magnetite and can be isolated from 250℃~580℃.Rocks from the fluvial and lacustrine facies are dominated by the pseudo-single domain(PSD) magnetite,the hematite,with a little amount of maghemite,the goethite,Its natural remanence intensity is greater than 1 10-1A/m generally,and the characteristic remanent magnetism(ChRM) are carried by hematite in most samples,and carried by magnetite and hematite in some samples.So investigation of rock magnetism on sediments from different sedimentary environments is important for the paloemagnetic research.

KlSRyaMq.title: Branched alkanes with quaternary carbon atoms in Chinese soils: Potential environmental implications
KlSRyaMq.abstract:
Lipids extracted from 26 modern soils collected from different climate zones in China and Mongolia are analyzed using gas
 chromatographymass spectrometry. These extracts contain pseudohomologous families of 5,5-diethylalkanes (5,5-DEAs), 6,6-diethylalkanes,
 5-butyl-5-ethylalkanes and 6-butyl-6-ethylalkanes, which are first detected in modern soils. All these pseudohomologous series
 display exclusively odd or exclusively even carbon numbers, clearly indicating a biosynthetic origin, and their carbon number
 distributions generally covary. The distributions of 5,5-DEAs exhibit strong regional variations, correlated with the spatial
 distributions of climate and vegetation. The lower molecular weight 5,5-DEAs, maximizing at C21 or C23, dominate in southeast and southwest China samples, while the higher molecular weight 5,5-DEAs with a mode at C29 dominate in cold, arid northwest China and Mongolia. The results demonstrate that the distribution of 5,5-DEAs can serve
 as a new independent proxy, indicating variations in soil ecosystems and climates, just like the well-known proxy of n-C15–21/n-C22–33 ratios.
keywords: branched alkanes with quaternary carbon atoms

SLypHkk2.title: Paleomagnetic Constraints on the Middle Miocene-Early Pliocene Stratigraphy in the Xining Basin, NE Tibetan Plateau, and the Geologic Implications
SLypHkk2.abstract: The Xining Basin lies in the transitional zone between the arid Asian interior and the East Asian monsoon region. The continuous Cenozoic sediments in the basin provide a unique archive recording the uplift of the Tibetan Plateau and its environmental effects on central Asian aridification and Asian monsoon evolution. However, sediments deposited since the middle Middle Miocene have not been precisely dated, hindering our ability to address these issues. Here, we dated a 336-m-thick section containing many Late Miocene fossil mammals from the eastern basin. High-resolution paleomagnetism revealed 16 normal and 16 reversed zones that correlate well with chrons 3n to 5Ar.1r of the Geomagnetic Polarity Time Scale, constraining the section to ∼12.7-4.8 Ma. The changes in lithofacies from floodplain to braided river at ∼8.6 Ma and to thick alluvial fan at ∼6.3 Ma with predominantly southerly paleocurrent directions occur simultaneously with an increase in the sedimentation rates, representing two periods of rapid uplift in the eastern Qilian Shan to the north. Our results provide a robust oldest age constraint (u003c4.8 Ma) on the ancient Huang Shui and Yellow River terraces on the basin sediments and eolian deposits on the terraces. The presence of well-developed floodplain paleosols, shallow lake marls and many large mammals in the lower section suggests that the monsoon climate in the late Middle Miocene to Late Miocene was more humid and stronger than that at present.

D9ihDzRx.title: Reply to the comment by Q.Q. Qiao et al. on “Cenozoic tectonic deformation and uplift of the South Tian Shan: Implications from magnetostratigraphy and balanced cross-section restoration of the Kuqa depression” by Tao Zhang, Xiaomin Fang, Chunhui Song, Erwin Appel, and Yadong Wang [Tectonophysics, 2014, doi:10.1016/j.tecto.2014.04.044]
D9ihDzRx.abstract: Qiao et al. (2016) commented on our work (Zhang et al., 2014) and rejected our reinterpretation of the magnetostratigraphic results of Huang et al. (2006) and Li et al. (2006), with the results gained using the Dynamic Time Warping Algorithm technique (DTWAT) as their main basis. However, Qiao et al. (2016) did not provide details of their modeling inputs, and, in particular, the parameters they chose for their calculations, where such parameters can have a serious impact upon any results. We therefore performed calculations using the same software (i.e., Qupydon) as Qiao et al. (2016), using reliable parameter settings. The results showed that the interesting  of a 6000 minimum cost output completely correlate with the magnetostratigraphic Chrons C18r to C3An.1n (similar to 40-6 Ma), which is consistent with our reinterpreted magnetostratigraphic results. Furthermore, we summarized previous biostratigraphic studies of nearby areas; the data resulting from this process also supported our reinterpreted magnetostratigraphic correlation. We were therefore able to confirm the revised magnetostratigraphic correlation of Zhang et al. (2014). (C) 2017 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

ImmLDvNo.title: Preparation and characterization of a biodegradable poly(malic-co-butanediol)elastomer
ImmLDvNo.abstract: A novel biodegradable poly(malic-co-butanediol)ester elastomer(PBM)was synthesized by condensation of malic acid and 1,4-butyl glycol.The structure of material was characterized.The hydrophilicity and degradation of the PBM were discussed.The PBM films were amorphous,transparent and flexible.The glass transition temperatures(Tg)of PBM were all below 0 ℃ and some of them are elastomeric.The biodegradation,water uptake and swelling reversibility properties of the elastomer could be modulated by adjusting the monomers ratio and post-polymerization time.

NqBkgLVN.title: Late Cenozoic tectonic deformation of the Linxia Basin, northeastern margin of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau
NqBkgLVN.abstract: The Linxia Basin, located on the northeastern margin of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, is a compressional flexural foreland basin. At the boundary of the basin, the fold and thrust fault zone has expanded towards to the interior of the basin from west to east since 7.78 Ma, while growth strata and growth unconformities formed, reflecting a continuous process of tectonic deformation on the northeast edge of Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. This kind of tectonic deformation accompanying deposition persisted until the complete deposition of the Dongshan Formation at about 1.8 Ma. The strong folding of the strata includes the Dongshan Formation and lower older units in the Linxia Basin. The Dongshan Formation and the upper, oldest terrace of Yellow River, the Jinggou Formation of conglomerate, form an angular unconformity. Therefore, the Lajishan Mountain expanded continuously to the NE until the Yinchuan anticline formed. Then a new stage in the development of the Yellow River and Daxia River appeared, river terraces developed, and aeolian loess was deposited. The total crustal shortening is about 3.2-3.6 km on the western margin of the Linxia Basin since 7.8 Ma; thus, the average shortening rate has been about 0.41-0.46 mm/a calculated from the balanced cross-section. If we select a 6.0 Myr period between 7.8 Ma and 1.8 Ma as the period of tectonic deformation, then the shortening rate is about 0.5-0.6 mm/a. Both the style of development and the evolution of the Linxia Basin suggest that the tectonic deformation on the northeast margin of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau is characterized by thrusting and crustal shortening with a WNW orientation. Such tectonic deformation led to the following evolution: the foreland basin gradually rose and sedimentation stopped, then most of the Cenozoic foreland basin merged into the northeast margin and became the newest part of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.

jAsuG39a.title: Provenance analysis reveals mountain uplift in the midsection of the Altyn Tagh Fault during the Middle Miocene
jAsuG39a.abstract: The Altyn Tagh Fault (ATF) defines the northern margin of the Tibetan Plateau; therefore, its tectonic history is key to understanding the plateau’s northward growth. However, our understanding of ATF tectonics is incomplete, owing in part to a lack of constraints in detailed basin evolution studies of this region. Approximately 1700 m of Middle Miocene – Pliocene clastic strata extracted from a section of the Yitunbulake Basin adjacent to the midsection of the ATF records the uplift of the Altyn Tagh Range. This paper reports 490 concordant detrital zircon U–Pb ages derived from this set of strata. In addition, paleocurrents and conglomerate clastic compositions were measured to determine the provenance of the basin. The dominant detrital zircon age populations within these sedimentary rocks are 260–240, 500–400, and 950–900 Ma. The 260–240 Ma component decreases sharply above the Lower (Xia) Youshashan (XYSS) Formation. Moreover, we performed (U–Th)/He dating on 260–240 Ma detrital zircons from the XYSS...

Qyy5dYrH.title: Late Pliocene-Quaternary evolution of redox conditions in the western Qaidam paleolake (NE Tibetan Plateau) deduced from Mn geochemistry in the drilling core SG-1
Qyy5dYrH.abstract: Manganese (Mn) in lake sediments reacts strongly to changes of redox conditions. This study analyzed Mn concentrations in oxides, carbonates, and bulk phases of the calcareous lacustrine sediments of a 938.5-m-long core (SG-1) taken from the western Qaidam Basin, well dated from 2.77Ma to 0.1Ma. Comparisons of extractions from diluted hydrochloric acid, acetic acid and citrate-bicarbonate-dithionite demonstrate that variations of Mn concentrations from acetic acid leaching (MnHOAc) are mostly responsible for Mn (II) fluctuations in the carbonate phase. Taking into account the relevant processes during weathering, transportation, deposition and post-deposition of Mn-bearing rocks, we conclude that Mn input from catchment weathering and paleolake redox condition provide the primary controls on variations in the Mn records of carbonate and oxide phases. We propose MnHOAc as a new sensitive indicator of paleolake redox evolution and catchment-scale climate change. The MnHOAc variations show a long-term upward decreasing trend, indicating a long-term decrease of Mn input from catchment weathering associated with increasing oxygen content in the paleolake bottom water. The great similarities of the MnHOAc record with other regional and global records suggest that paleolake redox changes and climatic drying in the Qaidam Basin may be largely related to global cooling. © 2013 University of Washington.

CDUAZ0yB.title: Magnetostratigraphy of the Middle-Upper Jurassic sedimentary sequences at Yanshiping, Qiangtang Basin, China
CDUAZ0yB.abstract: A series of important geological events occurred in the Tibetan Plateau area during the Jurassic, such as the collision of the Lhasa and Qiangtang Terranes, the closure of the Meso-Tethyan Ocean, the opening of the Neo-Tethyan Ocean and the cessation of the mega-monsoon. The similar to 3000 m thick Jurassic sedimentary sequence in the Qiangtang Basin on the central Tibetan Plateau, which is called the Yanshiping (YSP) Group, recorded these geological events. However, the chronology of the sequence is surprisingly poorly constrained. Here, we perform a detailed palaeomagnetic analysis on the similar to 1060 m thick middle and upper portions of the YSP Group (the Xiali and Suowa Formations) in the YSP section of the eastern Qiangtang Basin. Three bivalve zones at stratigraphic intervals of similar to 40-140, 640-800 and 940-1040 m are identified, which yield a Bathonian-Callovian age for the Lower Xiali Fm., a Callovian-Oxfordian age for the Lower Suowa Fm. and an Oxfordian-Kimmeridgian age for the Upper Suowa Fm. A total of 544 oriented palaeomagnetic samples were collected from the section. By combining thermal and alternating field demagnetizations, clear characteristic remanent magnetization (ChRM) directions are isolated for most of the samples. The robust ChRM directions pass fold and reversals tests, which support the primary nature of the ChRMs and yield a palaeopole at 76.8A degrees N/297.2A degrees E (dp = 2.2A degrees, dm = 3.7A degrees). A total of 27 normal and 26 reversed polarity zones were successfully recorded in the section. Combined with fossil age constraints, results suggest that the section is plausibly composed of a Callovian-Early Kimmeridgian age sedimentary sequence.

HDmQTpW4.title: Synthesis and structural characterization of diphenyl chlorophosphate
HDmQTpW4.abstract: Diphenyl chlorophosphate(DPCP) was synthesized with phenol and phosphorus oxychloride as the raw materials and anhydrous aluminum trichloride as the catalyst.The effects of reaction temperature,reaction time,catalyst dosage,and raw material molar ratio on the yield were investigated by orthogonal test,and the optimal reaction condition was established accordingly.Besides,the structure of as-synthesized DPCP product was characterized by means of infrared spectrometry and nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy.Results indicate that,in terms of the effect on the yield,various factors can be ranked as reaction temperature>raw material molar ratio>catalyst dosage>reaction time.The optimal reaction condition is suggested as reaction temperature of 70 ℃,reaction time of 15 h,raw material molar ratio(phenol to phosphorus oxychloride) of 2∶1,and catalyst dosage of 0.8 g(mass ratio of 4.25% in relation to phenol).In the meantime,post-treatment with the addition of adequate water helps to increase the yield of the product and improve operability as well.

C8UGRsOd.title: A record of the Blake Event during the last interglacial paleosol in the western Loess Plateau of China
C8UGRsOd.abstract: A high-resolution record of the Blake Event has been obtained from a 40 m well dug in a loess section at Jiuzhoutai in the City of Lanzhou in the western Loess Plateau of China. The paleomagnetic signal is principally carried by magnetite both in loess and paleosols. The Blake Event is located at the boundary between paleosol S1-c of the last interglacial (equivalent to MIS 5e in deep-sea records) and loess L2-2 (MIS 5d), and is characterized by a triple feature consisting of two short reversed intervals separated by a short normal interval. The directional changes are abrupt, as previously revealed in other records, and suggest geocentric dipole field behavior before, after and during the event, but not necessarily during N R or R N transitions. The age and duration of the event are estimated as between 119.97 and 114.47 kyr BP and 5.5 kyr, respectively, from thermoluminescence dating and astronomically tuned climate stratigraphy based on high-resolution magnetic susceptibility. Keywords paleomagnetism Brunhes Epoch Loess Plateau

ETwsK0aF.title: Microbial Habitability and Pleistocene Aridification of the Asian Interior.
ETwsK0aF.abstract: Fluid inclusions trapped in ancient halite can contain a community of halophilic prokaryotes and eukaryotes that inhabited the surface brines from which the halite formed. Long-term survival of bacteria and archaea and preservation of DNA have been reported from halite, but little is known about the distribution of microbes in buried evaporites. Here we report the discovery of prokaryotes and single-celled algae in fluid inclusions in Pleistocene halite, up to 2.26 Ma in age, from the Qaidam Basin, China. We show that water activity (aw), a measure of water availability and an environmental control on biological habitability in surface brines, is also related to microbe entrapment in fluid inclusions. The aw of Qaidam Basin brines progressively decreased over the last ∼1 million years, driven by aridification of the Asian interior, which led to decreased precipitation and water inflow and heightened evaporation rates. These changes in water balance produced highly concentrated brines, which reduced the habitability of surface lakes and decreased the number of microbes trapped in halite. By 0.13 Ma, the aw of surface brines approached the limits tolerated by halophilic prokaryotes and algae. These results show the response of microbial ecosystems to climate change in an extreme environment, which will guide future studies exploring deep life on Earth and elsewhere in the Solar System. Key Words: Halite fluid inclusions-Ancient microbes-Water activity-Qaidam Basin-Pleistocene aridification. Astrobiology 16, xxx-xxx.

9zNnNyqZ.title: Tectonosedimentary evolution model of an intracontinental flexural (foreland) basin for paleoclimatic research
9zNnNyqZ.abstract: Intracontinental flexural (foreland) basin sediments are now frequently used as archives for detailed paleoclimatic and sedimentary environmental reconstruction, fossil and stratigraphic correlation, and tectonic evolution and uplift of basin and orogen. However, sedimentologic characteristics vary considerably in time-space with the evolution of flexural basin, apt to cause misinterpretation of climatic change and stratigraphic correlation. Based on high resolution fossil mammal and magnetostratigraphic constraints and sedimentary facies analysis, here we took the Linxia Basin at the front of the NE Tibetan Plateau as a case to demonstrate and figure out a model how sedimentology and stratigraphy vary temporospatially with the evolution of such flexural basin. The results show that the Linxia Basin is a type intracontinental foreland basin subjected to two phases of flexural deformation exerted by the West Qin Ling (Mts.) and NE Tibetan Plateau to the south. Phase I began latest at the beginning of the Miocene (233 Ma), indicated by a balanced fast flexural subsidence and mostly fine sediment infilling giving rise to the early underlying unconformity. It manifests as an obvious sediment wedge with high filling rate, thickening toward mountains and an occurrence of a mountains-parallel big river - shallow lake system along the foredeep, suggesting a less high mountain topography. In the late Phase I, from similar to 13 Ma to 8 Ma, the subsidence and thickening rates began to decrease, accompanied by faults and deformation propagating gradually into the basin, causing gradual basinward migration of the foredeep and its accompanying river-lake system. Since similar to 8 Ma in Phase II, the West Qin Ling and NE Tibetan began to uplift rapidly and thrust/load onto the Linxia Basin, causing strong mountain erosion, thrust-fold belt propagation and basin overfilling. This forced the mountains-parallel river - lake system to turn to the mountains-perpendicular alluvial - braided river system, and finally to an outflow system by the Quaternary onset of the Yellow River in the basin. Concurrent are rapid rotation of the basin, occurrence of growth strata and late unconformities, widespread expansion of boulder conglomerates, great decreasing and increasing sedimentation rates above and before the hanging wall of the fault-fold system and new supplementary provenance from the thrust-fold system. This demonstrates that in stable climate, same lithologic units such as distinct lacustrine sediments and alluvial conglomerates will migrate basinwards with the foredeep moving into basin, causing a great diachroneity and often misleads to recognize the same lithologic unit in space as one unit in time. A dynamic model is presented that should help to avoid such pitfalls in tectonic basin evolution, especially concerning stratigraphic correlation and paleoclimatic change research. Pgg5vldZ.title: Pliocene-Pleistocene stepwise drying of Central Asia: Evidence from paleomagnetism and sporopollen record of the deep borehole SG-3 in the western Qaidam Basin, NE Tibetan Plateau
Pgg5vldZ.abstract: Drying of the Asian interior has generally been linked to Tibetan Plateau uplift, retreat of the Para-Tethys Sea and global cooling. However, lack of detailed aridification records hinders elucidation of how drying is controlled by these factors and to what extent each factor contributes. In this study, a 600. m deep core (SG-3) of lacustrine-playa deposits was obtained from the western Qaidam Basin, NE Tibetan Plateau for pollen analysis. Magnetostratigraphic dating of the core determines its age at ca. 3.1-0.01. Ma. The palynologic compositions show that a steppe to desert vegetation predominates the core. Artemisia-dominated steppe representative of relative warm and wet climate before 2.6. Ma changed to Chenopodiaceae-dominated steppe desert under drier climate conditions between 2.6. Ma and 0.9. Ma, interrupted by a short moister interval of Artemisia-dominated steppe at 1.8-1.2. Ma. From 0.9. Ma to 0.6. Ma, Chenopodiaceae-Ephedraceae desert vegetation started to develop, and since 0.6. Ma, Ephedraceae-dominated desert prevailed. This vegetation change in the western Qaidam Basin suggests a stepwise long-term aridification of the central Asia inland beginning at ca. 2.6. Ma, 1.2. Ma, 0.9. Ma and 0.6. Ma since the late Pliocene, most probably as a response to both long-term global cooling and Tibetan Plateau uplift at those times. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.

akelJP2x.title: International flame retardant markets and its features and developmental trends
akelJP2x.abstract: The consumption of flame retardants by major regions(America,Western Europe and Japan) and types are summarized and described.The features,developmental trends and prospects of these three big markets are analyzed and discussed.In the next few years,the global annual growth rate of flame retardants will probably be at 3.5%～4.0%.At the present time and in the near future,the brominated flame retardants are still playing and will continue to play an important role.In consideration of the environmental protection and flame retardant regulations which will be issued in the coming years,more stringent requirements of heat release rate,smoke generation and toxicity of combusted products of flame-retarded materials will be put forward.This would surely cause certain changes in applications of some existing flame retardants.The use of low-smoke,low-toxicity,and environmental friendly flame retardants will be promoted.And the tailor-made composite flame retardants will be more and more popular in the field of flame retardancy.At the end of this paper a number of suggestions on the flame retardant industry of China are made.

BowPyPeo.title: Mapping CACNA1S Gene in Porcine by Radiation Hybrid Panel
BowPyPeo.abstract: CACNA1S gene encodes the α_1 subunit of Calcium channel.The mutation of CACNA1S gene can lead to hypokalemic periodic paralysis in human and Malignant hyperthermia in porcine.Primers were designed according to the published human CACNA1S sequences for amplification of porcine CACNA1S gene.PCR products were sequenced and compared with that of human.CACNA1S gene was located at 10p~(11-12) in porcine by IMpRH panel(INRA-University of Minnesota porcine Radiation Hybrid panel).

7YDUi8QD.title: Study on halogen-free flame retardancy of high resilience polyurethane foam
7YDUi8QD.abstract: With increasing ecological and environmental concerns,the use of halogenated flame-retardants are being limited and halogen-free alternatives will be developed rapidly.Resorcinol bis(dipheny1 phosphate)(RDP) is a non-halogen aromatic oligomeric phosphate flame-retardant and flow modifier.Its high thermal stability and low volatility make it ideal for use in applications where high processing temperatures are required.In this paper,RDP was used as a single flame retardant of resilience polyurethane foam,and used together with exfoliated graphite(EG) as synergistic flame retardant.The limited oxygen index(LOI) of foam specimen was tested according to the GB 2406—80 standard and vertical flammability was tested in terms of CCAR25.853(b) Flammability Teat Method.

niuv1WZw.title: Synthesis and property of benzoxazine resin based on bis-spiro-substituted cyclotriphosphazene
niuv1WZw.abstract: A novel benzoxazine based bis-spiro-substituted cyclotriphosphazene(HCP) were synthesized from hexachlorocyclotriphosphazene,2,2(-biphenol,4-hydroxybenzoic acid ethyl ester and benzoxazine with active group.The structure of target compounds was confirmed by FT-IR,1H NMR,13C NMR and 31P NMR.The curing behavior of HCP,thermal stability of its homopolymer and its copolymer with bisphenol-based benzoxazine(Bz) was investigated.The results indicated that the initial thermal decomposition temperature of HCP homopolymer was 333℃ under nitrogen atmosphere,and the char yield was 42% at 800℃.The copolymer of HCP and Bz had even better thermal stability and char formation than any homopolymer of HCP and Bz,whose temperature with 5%weight-loss was 367℃ and the char yield was 52% at 800℃.

TkjjuFzA.title: Characteristics and implications of hematite and goethite concentration in sediments of the late miocene,Linxia Basin
TkjjuFzA.abstract: The miocene sediments in the Linxia basin are important for understanding the Qinghai-Tibetan plateau uplift and the east Asian monsoon developments.Hematite and goethite from the Heilinding section in the southern margin of the Linxia basin(11.8～5.0 Ma) were tested.The content of the hematite was high in 11.88.6 Ma,decreasing obviously at 8.6 Ma and kept stable in 8.6～5.0 Ma,whereas goethite was almost stable throughout the period.The trend of hematite/goethite ration was similar to hematite content.Such hematite, goethite and hematite/goethite contents in the Heilinding section probably indicate a strong aridification process since 8.6 Ma in central Asia,which was linked to the Qinghai-Tibetan plateau uplift during this time.
